thread.title: Uttar Pradesh Assembly Elections 2017 Live Updates: BJP has copied our promises, says Akhilesh Yadav
thread.title_full: Uttar Pradesh Assembly Elections 2017 Live Updates: BJP has copied our promises, says Akhilesh Yadav - The Financial Express

author: FE Online
title: Uttar Pradesh Assembly Elections 2017 Live Updates: BJP has copied our promises, says Akhilesh Yadav
text:
While PM Narendra Modi speaks about ‘Kabristan’ and ‘shamshaan’, we speak about distributing laptops and smartphones, says Akhilesh Yadav. (ANI) Here are latest updates on Uttar Pradesh Elections-related events:
12:15 pm: While PM Narendra Modi speaks about ‘Kabristan’ and ‘shamshaan’, we speak about distributing laptops and smartphones, says Akhilesh Yadav at the rally.
11:55 am: BJP has copied our promises, says Akhilesh Yadav
11:45 am: Yesterday PM Narendra Modi gave a three page speech at a rally, but there was nothing on farmers, says UP CM Akhilesh Yadav at Siddarthnagar rally.
10:45 am: The Congress came down heavily on Prime Minister Narendra Modi over his Kanpur train accident remark, questioning if ISI had been guilty, why was allowed to investigate the Pathankot attack. Congress leader Tom Vadakkan expressed shock over discussing an intelligence report in a public rally, adding that why was nothing been done yet.
10:15 am: Putting the ball back in Prime Minister Narendra Modi court on Kanpur Train accident, the Samajwadi Party on Saturday said it is the Indian government’s duty to take cognisance of the matter and take required steps. Terming it as a way of gaining votes, Samajwadi Party leader Naresh Agarwal said the Prime Minister is doing nothing about the everyday attack taking place in the Valley.
9:30 am: Slamming Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) president Amit Shah ’s comment over increased crimes in Uttar Pradesh, the Samajwadi Party on Saturday asked the former to check his own ministers’ actions first and then comment on any state. “What would Amit Shah say on Gujarat sex scandal? What would he say on his MP shooting his own wife? What would he say on Sangeet Som, Sanjay Baliyan? Amit Shah should answer all these questions and only then raise a question on Uttar Pradesh,” Samajwadi Party leader Juhi Singh told ANI.
8:58 am: Congress vice president Rahul Gandhi to address rallies in Bahraich, Gonda and Sultanpur today
As Uttar Pradesh going on fifth phase of Assembly elections Congress vice president Rahul Gandhi to address rallies in Bahraich, Gonda and Sultanpur today. During this phase, 52 seats will go to polls. Political slugfest is already begun on BJP president Amit Shah’s controversial ‘KASAB’ remark. Shah was slammed by Mayawati and Chief Minister Akhilesh Yadav for his statement with the BSP supremo going to the extent of calling the BJP chief a “terrorist”. In a stinging retaliation to the BJP president’s remark made, Mayawati said there “cannot be a bigger Kasab” than Shah. Hitting out at Shah, Akhilesh said, “BJP people have lost the battle on the ground and so their language has changed.” Shah had used the acronym ‘KASAB’, saying ‘Ka’ (in Hindi) stands for Congress, ‘Sa’ for Samajwadi Party and ‘Ba’ for BSP. He had said that till KASAB is laid to rest, UP will not have development.
The fourth phase of polling for 53 assembly constituencies of Uttar Pradesh had passed off amid stray incidents of violence on February 23, with an estimated over 61 per cent voter turnout. This phase of voting was crucial for the state’s ruling Samajwadi Party and main opposition BSP, both major contenders for power this time too, as they had won nearly 40 of these seats in the previous polls. 680 candidates, including 61 women, were in the fray for 53 seats. In the 2012 Assebmly polls, Samajwadi Party had won 24, BSP 15, Congress six, BJP five and others three seats.
